newsitem.title: CHINA: China says U.S. sanctions over Iran unreasonable.
newsitem.headline: China says U.S. sanctions over Iran unreasonable.

text.p: China on Friday condemned U.S. sanctions on two Chinese firms for allegedly selling chemical weapons components to Iran as "unreasonable" and said it was firmly opposed to penalties.
"It's entirely unreasonable. China expresses its resolute opposition" to the sanctions, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang was quoted by Xinhua news agency as saying.
"(China) requests the United States to immediately rescind relevant sanctions against Chinese companies and individuals," Shen said.
China opposed the development of chemical weapons by any country and would not assist any country in developing such weapons, he said.

The United States on Thursday imposed sanctions on Jiangsu Yongli Chemical Engineering and Technology Import/Export Corp and its parent company, Nanjing Chemical Industries Group, because it believes they transferred chemical weapons components to Iran.
The United States also imposed sanctions on five Chinese citizens -- Liao Minglong, Tian Yi, Chen Qingchang, Pan Yongming and Shao Xingsheng -- and a Hong Kong company, Cheong Yee Ltd.
